alert.note: Alert for Northern El Paso County Including Monument and Black Forest; Southern Front Range Including Sangre De Cristo Mountains, Wet Mountains, La Veta Pass; Teller County, Rampart Range Including Pikes Peak and Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 22 at 3:59AM MDT until April 22 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 9 AM to 9 PM MDT Friday for gusty winds, low relative humidity values, and dry lighting, for fire weather zones 220, 221, 222, and 224 through 237, which includes the San Luis Valley, the Wet Mountain Valley, and all of the southeast mountains and plains. The dry lightning may occur across Kiowa, Bent, Prowers and Baca counties... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for Saturday morning through Saturday evening for gusty winds and low relative humidity values, for fire weather zones 224, 222 and 227 through 237, which includes the San Luis Valley, Fremont county, and most of the southeast plains... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 221...225 AND 226... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 221...225 and 226. * Winds...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Timing...Friday, 9 AM to 9 PM. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for extreme rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur during the warning time. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Cloud to Ground lightning may ignite grass fires over the plains.
